X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

We had experienced a problem with the '�' character, when committed to CVS
by Eclipse on Windows, causing problems for Eclipse's editors and build
process on Linux.

A quick test indicates that if on Windows you use the Eclipse -> Window ->
Preferences -> Workbench -> Editors -> Default Text Encoding setting to
choose "UTF-8", rather than the Windows default, subsequent entries of
the '�' will work fine when transported to Linux Eclipse.

(Linux Eclipse seems to use UTF-8 as its default.)

There may be other side-effects of this change on Windows, but it's worth
a try.

- Gordon
